friends neighbors police and volunteers search the entire area looking for any signs of her but they found nothing

when questioned the fries and the blood was a result of an accident an explanation police found almost too convenient I talked to win Friday about that ask him if he'd injured himself or anything he had an injury on his phone

just seem very kind and motivated and a little bit like to burn out I just thought they were kind of odd people didn't seem particularly dangerous or wasn't any reason to fail I'm afraid of them I guess

tiny pieces of metal

the appeared to be shavings from a metal lay a machine that grinds and cuts metal

the autopsy revealed the cause of death was blunt force trauma to the head she had apparently been murdered around the time she disappeared
the autopsy also found evidence she had been sexually assaulted

investigators found those same aluminum metal shavings on Tracy's body along with chips of very old weathered green paint from that point law enforcement began looking for a construction site or really a woodworking shop to match up to
where did all of the small which savings come from where did all the metal shavings come from and so they went out really looking for any connection to a woodworking or a small base construction shop
investigators knew if they found the source of both the green paint and the aluminum shavings they would find the killer of 16 year old Tracy
records show that Tracy Parker used her neighbor's telephone to call a friend around 8:00 PM on the night she disappeared
hi Brian lord the handyman use the same phone to call his girlfriend 15 minutes earlier although he claimed he didn't see Tracy that night
lord said he stopped by his brothers workshop on his way home
when police searched the shop they found nothing suspicious nothing jumped out at us right away it appears that nothing really happened in the workshop
Brian lord allowed police to search his pickup truck and examine the clothes he said he was wearing the night Tracy disappeared investigators found no forensic evidence

but neighbors told police they saw lord washing his truck with the hose that night we had witnesses that had him cleaning his pick up truck which was very unusual for him to do that he was washing a truck without a shirt on in 57 degree weather and that sort of behavior it was hard to explain
naturally investigators found this suspicious
so they decided to take a much closer look inside his brother's workshop the floor looked remarkably clean and appeared to have been covered with some type of oil
to find out what was beneath it analysts sprayed the floor with the re agent called local malachite green that reacts with the protein in human blood

next analysts collected everything they could find in the workshop paint chips metal shavings woodchips debris dust dirt all were sent to the forensic lab
in the history of our crime laboratory which has been in existence since the 19 seventies this is by far the largest case as far as the volume of trace evidence that has been received
among the thousands of pieces of trace evidence investigators identified wood chips and paint fragments
but the wood chips were so small it was impossible to tell whether they match those found on Tracy's body
the white paint chips were difficult to identify
the green ones work easier

collared paint has variables like the color pigments and binding agents synthetic and organic based materials that can be unique never in my life have I seen green paint with a match this green paint it was badly weathered and very old and it showed in the examination I did and I've never seen a pain like this before or since
the green paint chips were subjected to microscopic infrared and elemental analysis

Brian lord was tried and convicted of first degree murder and sentenced to death

a few years later lords guilty verdict was overturned on appeal he was tried and convicted again in 1999 and this time sentenced to life in prison without parole I think the overturning of capital murder cases is so routine that is aggravating but it's not a surprise after the first trial on appeal I believe it was our state Supreme Court that said in the written opinion that this was the most complex circumstantial trace evidence case that had ever been tried in the state and I'd be willing to wager that stands true I'm not so sure is this case would have been solved not been for the forensic evidence it was a forensic evidence to tie it all of the scenes together it was a forensic evidence that pointed directly at Frankie for
